data.title: Great home cooking with superior gluten-free offerings
data.text: Yo' Mama's always has several cops either sitting in for lunch or picking up to go orders.  This is a sure sign that the food is excellent and the service is quick and friendly.  Yo' Mama's offers a modest menu of excellent home cooking, with the fried chicken and burgers topping the list.  A special feature of the kitchen in ability to make most of the dishes gluten-free.  This is particularly welcome if you have celiac disease and are craving a good plate of fried chicken.  Don't miss this spot - just too bad it's only open for lunch during week-days (and two Saturdays a month).

data.title: Great Entrees! Fries, not sso much...
data.text: My wife and I went to the restaurant hoping to find a 'new' place to go for GF options. I must say, that the fish plate and the chicken plate portions were plenty. We placed our order at the counter, received our drinks/cups, and went to find a table. The drinks were advertised in the menu as Pepsi products, but when retrieved by the clerk, were actually Coke products (my preference, anyway). The soft drinks and water were bottled and the ice water, lemonade, and punch drinks were dispensed at the back of the restaurant. Our food arrived hot and was, for the most part, very tasty. At least the fish, chicken wings, and slaw were all very good. The GF crust was amazing! We both agreed that the fries, although hot, weren't very good. Ours were not seasoned at all, and there was a 'mix' of 'fresh' fries and 'darker' old fries. Along with being limp, there was no taste. Not impressed with them at all. By the time we sat down at our table, there was a line from the order counter, out the front door. This was definitely the place to be on a Friday for lunch. The atmosphere was enjoyable. The music was not overpowering, nor were the TVs too loud. The counter staff young lady (with a 'high & tight' haircut) was VERY cordial, and walked around the restaurant checking to be sure everyone had what they needed. She 'was' the PR for the restaurant! I would come back just because she seemed to genuinely care for her customers and their experience. Our server, with her short hair and big hoop earrings, was equally cordial and friendly. We will be back whenever we're in town. And, hopefully, to a better batch of fries... NOTE: Parallel parking, with meters, was on the street, and there was not a designated parking lot for patrons that we could find.

data.title: meh...not really that special
data.text: I went there and had the chicken and waffles, including a gluten free waffle (which cost and extra $1.50)...the service first of all was awful. i asked for a knife and fork and the staff pointed to where i should walk to (get up from my table) to get them myself. was a bit funny. as for the food, the waffle was nice. the chicken is chicken wings, and they were, ok...nothing special really...nothing at all to justify the price of the place...had a nice sauce to go with the waffles. but it is not a place i will return to, certainly not all that it is cracked up to be...its not awful, but it's not all that either...

data.title: Don't Slap Yo Mama!
data.text:
Because the food is so good you just might get slapped back!  Seriously, the other guys might say they are finger lickin good, but this place is the real deal. Located in downtown Birmingham, they are tucked away in a beautiful and colorful restaurant with plenty of natural light pouring in through the front windows. Order at the counter and if you are smart, order the fried wings platter. It comes with fries and slaw and is fried chicken perfection. You will have to wait a bit to get your meal because they are cooking everything fresh!  No wings and fries sitting under heat lamps here! The service is fantastic, the iced tea is perfect and fresh. In short, you need to visit yo mamas!

Note!  They are only open for lunch Monday through Friday and two Saturday's per month!

data.title: Yummy!
data.text: This was a nice little find during our trip.  The staff was warm and welcoming as we entered.  They answered all our questions and genuinely seemed happy we stopped in. The portions were large and the food was delicious.  I recommend trying the shrimp and grits, it was amazing.

data.title: Good food, great price fast service
data.text: Very nice place to eat with a variety of choices. Must have big appetite because you get plenty of food. The fried chicken is great but the shrimp is better. If you enjoy soul food this is the place for you. The restaurant is clean, the service is great and the food totally delicious.

data.title: AWESOME MEAL-FRIENDLY ENVIRONMENT!!!!
data.text: Me and my family has visited this restaurant on several occasions, also visited with out of town quest, food is always awesome and fresh, atmosphere very welcoming, service excellent.  Please visit show your support for this great group of people.

data.title: Business lunch
data.text: So the food will make you slap yo mama! I love to visit here when I can. Food is good, service is fast, and prices are reasonable.  My fave is chicken and waffles. Everything on the menu os tasty and the daily specials are great! This is what I ordered today and I was not disappointed. My friend ordered the shrimp and grits. We went today for a business lunch. Although it was crowded, we easily found seating, received our food fast and we were able to conduct our meeting without interruption. I highly recommend this place for lunch.....good food....

data.title: Tasty food, friendly folks
data.text:
Great food. I get the wings w/ fries and slaw (their own homemade) my wife likes the fish tacos. 

Friendly people and the food is always good. I get the fries a little crispy ;) and the wings with extra sauce.

data.title: 🔥🔥🔥
data.text: I'm from Memphis!!!! Gluten free chicken N waffles was off the meatrack!!!! You GOTTA get the wing sauce to dip ya chicken in!! It's amazing

data.title: Awesome
data.text: Great food and service!! I ordered Chicken and waffles!!!  Wow!!!! The homemade syrup was a pleasant surprise.. They really need to open on Sarurdays.  Next time, I will try shrimp and grits!!!

data.title: To Mamas Destination Resturant
data.text:
We stop every time we visit town!

Gluten free Fried chicken.  Heaven.

Gluten free waffles.  Oh my....

Nice atmosphere.  Have some quarters for parking.

data.title: Yummy Wings - great service
data.text: Yo'Mama's best feature is Cynthia! She's Mama's daughter and a wonderful host. Makes you feel at home. Got chicken and Waffles - yummy! Huge waffle made from scratch - fabulous syrup - topped with light, crispy wings. Will be back :)

data.title: Great lunch
data.text: Excellent . I ordered the wings and waffle. Really really good. The homemade syrup was delicious . Very light, very understated . The wings were large and fried perfectly. My associate ordered the shrimp and grits. Our sweet waitress brought him a big bowl full. Piping hot. Of course I ate some of his too. Had cut up sausage in grits . Just great. Servings are very big. Might be able to split .

data.title: Good shrimp
data.text: For the price the meal was pretty good, nice slaw dressing and shrimp was fried right.  Hand cut fries really good.

data.title: Crazy good broccoli
data.text: Service was really slow and we had to wait for a seat but the food was fabulous. I had the BBQ burger without the bun and broccoli instead of the fries as I'm trying to watch carbs right now. I don't even really care for broccoli but I could have eaten a big bowl of this stuff...best I've ever had. I will be back to try some of their daily specials.

data.title: Chicken & waffles
data.text: The fried chicken is delicious gluten-free wings made in a dedicated fryer. The gluten-free waffles are made on a dedicated waffle iron and have an apple flavor. The syrup was delicious as well. Brunch is only twice monthly, so check to confirm that it's offered. It's worth the trip for sure since its celiac safe with great allergy protocols.

data.title: Amazing Gluten Free and Regular Food!
data.text: This is a wonderful little place in downtown Birmingham, the owner and her staff cook with love. The gluten free waffles are a masterpiece! The GF burger and fried fish were spectacular. Best yet, they were so welcoming and friendly.

data.title: Somewhat Disappointed
data.text: Judging by the crowd when we went for lunch on a recent Friday, this is a really popular place. We were especially excited because the GF menu included some favorite fried foods! My hubby's fried shrimp was deemed "pretty good!" I wish I could say the same for my fried fish tacos.  I wanted them to be DELICIOUS, but they were only okay. I felt like they were dry and needed more seasoning. Staff was friendly and helpful. Glad we tried it.

data.title: Wow! Appropriately named!
data.text:
Hubby and I in town for medical appointments. We like to try different eateries each time we're here.  Found Johns, insulted, left without going in.  Yo Mama's was around the corner, saw the quaint colorful table and chairs outside and decided to try. Boy are we glad we did!  Beautiful family business,  beautiful environment,  music choice/volume excellent, the vibe there was simply sensational. Someone (s) has paid attention,  put a lot of thought and consideration into this business- the wonderful family.  The owners daughter cane to the table to talk and was genuinely interested in us and our experience. Mama, owner, took the time to come out from the kitchen and greet us as well.  Sorry guys, I'm terrible with names but that's of no reflection on the excellent customer service provided! 

On to the food... Splendid! I had the chicken and waffle with homemade whipped cream and berries. She makes this syrup NOT on the grocery store shelves that I would certainly purchase if it were in my favorite store where shopping is a pleasure (hint hint). Bottle the syrup ladies! Found I didn't need the syrup note the wonderful homemade whipped cream; the waffle stood out on is own and melted in my mouth before I could chew it!  Six good sized chicken wingettes, fried just right,  tender, juicy and flavorful. I've had this meal at several eateries, don't dismiss it because other eateries are doing it.  That would be a mistake,  this is by far the best I've had and we eat out regularly and all over the country... Hubby had the chicken salad on croissant with chips and fresh fruit. Chicken salad hearty and absolutely delicious! Tender,  moist, a myriad of flavors yet wonderfully balanced.  Portion was right on for the money.  

I can't say enough about this place.  Stop in and enjoy!  If I were local,  I'd be here weekly. Can't wait to go back.  I really felt as though I was at Yo Mama's lol! 

Shameless plug... visit Charm across the street. Bought a beautiful antique ring in there.  Has some beautiful pieces.  Owners a little potty mouth but if you can get past that,  you won't be disappointed!
